product_markup_rates.justification: Premium positioning justifies higher markup. Competitor prices average $200, so we recommend $189.99 to be competitive while maintaining target margin. Initial markup accounts for expected markdowns.
Mid-tier product with strong competition. Recommended price of $79.99 balances margin requirements with competitive positioning against $74.99-$89.99 range.
High competition category requires aggressive pricing. Recommended $119.99 matches lowest competitor while achieving target margin through initial markup buffer.
New technology features justify premium pricing. Recommended $149.99 positions between competitors while maintaining healthy margins.
Limited competition allows for higher markup. Recommended $169.99 is at the lower end of competitor range to drive volume while exceeding target margin.

exercise2.strategy_explanation: The strategy starts with moderate 20% markdown to stimulate early sales while preserving margin. Each week increases markdowns to maintain sales velocity, with steeper drops in weeks 3-4 when inventory is still substantial. The final weeks use aggressive markdowns to clear remaining stock before new season arrives. Labor Day weekend (week 6) benefits from maximum markdown to capitalize on increased traffic. Projections account for 5% weekly traffic decline and historical markdown performance.

product_pricing.positioning_strategy: Priced at mid-tier level to emphasize value proposition. 100% markup balances quality perception with price sensitivity (7/10).
Aggressive pricing for high-sensitivity (8/10) category. Matches mid-tier quality at budget-adjacent price point.
Premium pricing justified by lower sensitivity (6/10) and health-conscious target market. Below premium competitors but with strong margin.
Conservative markup for high-sensitivity (9/10) essential item. Priced below mid-tier competitors to drive volume.
Premium positioning for low-sensitivity (5/10) professional market. Priced between mid-tier and premium competitors to highlight value.
